title: Typographic magazines
content:
I'm interested in subscribing to several magazine on typography. Domestic and international, doesn't matter what language it's set in. I would greatly appreciate the input.   
   
IM
author: ivan_melendez

comments.content:
In no particular order, here are the ones I recommend:   
Eye magazine (expensive)   
TYPO\* (Czech)   
tipoGrafica\* (Argentine)   
Baseline (expensive)   
   
\* These are 90% bilingual.   
   
hhp

' [Spatium](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.spatium-magazin.de/)', German + English ( [www.spatium-magazin.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.spatium-magazin.de/) )..   
' [tipoGr�fica](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.tipografica.com/)', Spanish + English ( [www.tipografica.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.tipografica.com/) )..   
' [TYPO](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.magtypo.cz/)', Czech + English ( [www.magtypo.cz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.magtypo.cz/) )..   
   
' [Tiypo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.tiypo.com/)', maybe.? ( [www.tiypo.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.tiypo.com/) )..

Well lucky you!   
   
I myself have just paid for a subscription of [Peter Bilaks](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/peterb.sk/) (of [Typotheque](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.typotheque.com/index.php)) and Stuart Baileys [Dot-dot-dot](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.dot-dot-dot.nl/) magazine, perhaps you should check it out too.   
   
�

The swiss typographic magazine [Typografische Monatsbl�tter](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.comedia.ch/de/2-Publikationen/TM/) (couldn't find a proper web page) used to be excellent. Haven't seen it in a while.   
I'm not sure it's multilingual (English/German/French) anymore, but since that wasn't a problem I'd like to recommend it warmly.   
   
�

there's this magazine, grafik, coming out of the uk which is pretty rad. i think it's graphic design and type, so it's similar to what baseline or eye would cover.   
   
 [http://www.grafikmagazine.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.grafikmagazine.co.uk/)   
   
xo   
davy

I don't mean to rain on the grafik parade, but to me it is like the other "trendy" fashion/design mags like IdN and such. Baseline is excellent, it is an absolutely beautiful piece of work, a thing of beauty. You could also try Emigre if you like American pro-active design/type theory and critique.   
   
kris.

BTW, weeks ago I found in a second hand book store an issue of the old Typographica magazine with a nice Walter Tracy's article about phone directories. Pages of about 12 different phone books are included en compared. Great!

Baseline: the price reduction is strange, because for years I've seen it on the stands for between 18 and 20 dollars... BTW, I'll be selling my entire collection (almost 30 issues, some extremely rare - almost all in mint condition) on eBay soon. It certainly was and is a great magazine, but I let my subscription lapse, and don't want to be stuck with a partial collection. My reserve price won't be too low, so start saving up, or get a rich spouse/mate to buy it for you for xmas or something... :-)   
   
Ramiro, yes, that was an amazing article!   
   
hhp
Or check [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053142/http:/www.typebooks.org/periodicals-ndx.htm) rather comprehensive list out
